intro: Caucanthus squarrosus var. benadirensis, commonly known as the Benadirensis variant, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly foliage and showy yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a conservation concern in its native habitat.
